DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Study Agent Infusion Procedure Delay Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Amount of time (in hours and minutes) the study drug is held for all infusion catheters. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Study Agent Infusion Procedure All Catheter Delay
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion._To a complete degree or to the full or entire extent._(KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body._Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time; the state of being slower or later._

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical trial.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)
